UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Stores user account information, excluding sensitive authentication data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the account was last updated.

role.description: Role of user, either admin, vendor, or customer.

definition.description: Stores user account information. The `userId` parameter corresponds to the Firebase Auth UID, providing path-based ownership and simplifying security rules.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, matching their Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and simplifies security rules. User accounts are stored under `/users/{userId}`. This path-based ownership model provides strong isolation and simplifies access control, enabling atomic operations and clear authorization logic. The structure allows for secure list operations using path-based rules (QAPs) since each user's data is isolated within their own collection.

Authorization Independence: This design enforces authorization independence by leveraging path-based ownership. Since user data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, access control can be enforced solely based on `request.auth.uid` matching the `userId` without needing to retrieve data from other documents.

QAPs: The design facilitates secure list operations by structurally segregating user data.  Listing documents within `/users/{userId}` only requires checking that `request.auth.uid == userId`, which avoids complex filtering logic in rules and enables efficient queries.
